Description: Copper-alloy coin, issue of Ptolemy I or Ptolemy II struck between 305 and 246BC, with the head of Alexander the Great wearing an elephant scalp headdress on on the obverse side and an eagle standing on a thunderbolt on the reverse side.
Cultures/periods: Ptolemaic (found in occupation deposit of c. 1000AD)
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Bibliographic references: Adams 2000 / Meinarti I The Late Meroitic, Ballana and Transitional Occupation (p. 56, 63; pl. 15b, 2; pl. 15c)
